bo

class jaxbo.bo.BOBE(loglikelihood=None, n_cobaya_init=4, n_sobol_init=32, min_evals=200, max_eval_budget=1500, max_gp_size=1200, resume=False, resume_file=None, save=True, save_step=25, noise=1e-08, fit_step=10, kernel='rbf', wipv_batch_size=4, ns_step=10, num_hmc_warmup=512, num_hmc_samples=512, mc_points_size=64, mc_points_method='NUTS', lengthscale_priors='DSLP', acq='WIPV', zeta_ei=0.1, use_clf=True, clf_type='svm', clf_use_size=300, clf_update_step=5, clf_threshold=250, gp_threshold=5000, logz_threshold=1.0, convergence_n_iters=2, minus_inf=-100000.0, pool=None, do_final_ns=True, return_getdist_samples=False, optimizer='optax', seed=None)[source]

Bases: object

__init__(loglikelihood=None, n_cobaya_init=4, n_sobol_init=32, min_evals=200, max_eval_budget=1500, max_gp_size=1200, resume=False, resume_file=None, save=True, save_step=25, noise=1e-08, fit_step=10, kernel='rbf', wipv_batch_size=4, ns_step=10, num_hmc_warmup=512, num_hmc_samples=512, mc_points_size=64, mc_points_method='NUTS', lengthscale_priors='DSLP', acq='WIPV', zeta_ei=0.1, use_clf=True, clf_type='svm', clf_use_size=300, clf_update_step=5, clf_threshold=250, gp_threshold=5000, logz_threshold=1.0, convergence_n_iters=2, minus_inf=-100000.0, pool=None, do_final_ns=True, return_getdist_samples=False, optimizer='optax', seed=None)[source]

Initialize the BOBE sampler class.

Parameters:

  • loglikelihood (external_loglike) – The loglikelihood function to be used. Must be an instance of external_loglike.

  • n_cobaya_init (int) – Number of initial points from the cobaya reference distirbution when starting a run. Is only used when the likelihood is an instance of cobaya_loglike, otherwise ignored.

  • n_sobol_init (int) – Number of initial Sobol points for sobol when starting a run.

  • min_evals (int) – Minimum number of true objective evaluations before checking convergence.

  • max_eval_budget (int) – Maximum number of true objective function evaluations.

  • max_gp_size (int) – Maximum number of points used to train the GP. If using SVM, this is not the same as the number of points used to train the SVM.

  • resume (bool) – If True, resume from a previous run. The resume_file argument must be provided.

  • resume_file (str) – The file to resume from. Must be a GP file (without _gp extension).

  • save (bool) – If True, save the GP training data to a file so that it can be resumed from later.

  • fit_step (int) – Number of iterations between GP refits.

  • ns_step (int) – Number of iterations between nested sampling runs.

  • num_hmc_warmup (int) – Number of warmup steps for HMC sampling.

  • num_hmc_samples (int) – Number of samples to draw from the GP.

  • mc_points_size (int) – Number of points to use for the weighted integrated posterior variance acquisition function.

  • mc_points_method (str) – Method to use for generating the MC points. Options are ‘NUTS’, ‘NS’, or ‘uniform’. Recommend to use ‘NUTS’ for most cases, ‘NS’ can be a good choice if the underlying likelihood has a highly complex structure.

  • lengthscale_priors (str) – Lengthscale priors to use. Options are ‘DSLP’ or ‘SAAS’. See the GP class for more details.

  • use_clf (bool) – If True, use SVM to filter the GP predictions. This is only required for high dimensional problems and when the scale of variation of the likelihood is extremely large. For cosmological likelihoods with nuisance parameters, this is highly recommended.

  • clf_use_size (int) – Minimum size of the classifier training set before the classifier filter is used in the GP.

  • clf_update_step (int) – Number of iterations between classifier updates.

  • logz_threshold (float) – Threshold for convergence of the nested sampling logz. If the difference between the upper and lower bounds of logz is less than this value, the sampling will end.

  • convergence_n_iters (int) – Number of successive iterations the logz threshold must be met for convergence to be declared. Defaults to 2.

  • minus_inf (float) – Value to use for minus infinity. This is used to set the lower bound of the loglikelihood.

run(n_log_ei_iters=100)[source]

Run the iterative Bayesian Optimization loop.

Parameters:

None

Returns:

  • gp (GP object) – The fitted GP object.

  • ns_samples (MCSamples | Nested sampling samples) – The samples from the final nested sampling run. This is a either a getdist MCSamples instance or a dictionary with the following keys [‘x’,’weights’,’logl’].

  • logz_dict (dict) – The logz dictionary from the nested sampling run. This contains the upper and lower bounds of the logz.

check_convergence(step, logz_dict, equal_samples, equal_logl, kl_method='gaussian')[source]

Check if the nested sampling has converged and compute KL divergence metrics.

Parameters:

  • step – Current iteration number

  • logz_dict – Dictionary with logz bounds and mean

  • ns_samples – Nested sampling samples with x, weights, logl

  • threshold – LogZ convergence threshold

Returns:

Whether convergence is achieved based on logz only

Return type:

bool

jaxbo.gp.dist_sq(x, y)[source]

Compute squared Euclidean distance between two points x, y. If x is n1 x d and y is n2 x d returns a n1 x n2 matrix of distancess.

Computes only the diagonal of the kernel matrix K(x,x).

class jaxbo.gp.GP(train_x, train_y, noise=1e-06, kernel='rbf', optimizer='optax', optimizer_kwargs={'lr': 0.005, 'name': 'adam'}, kernel_variance_bounds=[-4, 8], lengthscale_bounds=[-1.3010299956639813, 2], lengthscales=None, kernel_variance=None)[source]

Bases: object

Base class for the GP with no hyperparameter priors.

hyperparam_priors: str = 'uniform'
__init__(train_x, train_y, noise=1e-06, kernel='rbf', optimizer='optax', optimizer_kwargs={'lr': 0.005, 'name': 'adam'}, kernel_variance_bounds=[-4, 8], lengthscale_bounds=[-1.3010299956639813, 2], lengthscales=None, kernel_variance=None)[source]
Parameters:

  • train_x (jnp.ndarray) – Training inputs, size (N x D)

  • train_y (jnp.ndarray) – Objective function values at training points size (N x 1)

  • noise (float) – Noise parameter to add to the diagonal of the kernel, default 1e-8

  • kernel (str) – Kernel to use, either “rbf” or “matern”

Predicts the variance of the GP at x and unstandardizes it

predict_single(x)[source]

Predicts the mean and variance of the GP at x but does not unstandardize it. To use with EI and the like.

predict_batched(x)[source]
update(new_x, new_y, refit=True, maxiter=300, n_restarts=4)[source]

Updates the GP with new training points and refits the GP if refit is True.

Parameters:

  • refit (bool) – Whether to refit the GP hyperparameters. Default is True.

  • lr (float) – The learning rate for the optax optimizer. Default is 1e-2.

  • maxiter (int) – The maximum number of iterations for the optax optimizer. Default is 250.

  • n_restarts (int) – The number of restarts for the optax optimizer. Default is 2.

Returns:

repeat – Whether the point new_x, new_y already exists in the training set.

Return type:

bool

get_random_point(rng=None)[source]
sample_GP_NUTS(warmup_steps=256, num_samples=512, progress_bar=True, thinning=8, verbose=True, init_params=None, temp=1.0, restart_on_flat_logp=True, num_chains=2, np_rng=None, rng_key=None)[source]

Obtain samples from the posterior represented by the GP mean as the logprob. Optionally restarts MCMC if all logp values are the same or if HMC fails.

copy()[source]

Returns a deep copy of the GP with the same training data, hyperparameters, and fitted state. The copy is independent: modifications to the new GP do not affect the original.

property hyperparams

Returns the current hyperparameters of the GP.

property npoints

Returns the number of training points.

class jaxbo.gp.DSLP_GP(train_x, train_y, noise=1e-08, kernel='rbf', optimizer='optax', optimizer_kwargs={'lr': 0.001, 'name': 'adam'}, kernel_variance_bounds=[-4, 8], lengthscale_bounds=[-1.3010299956639813, 2], lengthscales=None, kernel_variance=None)[source]

Bases: GP

hyperparam_priors: str = 'dslp'
__init__(train_x, train_y, noise=1e-08, kernel='rbf', optimizer='optax', optimizer_kwargs={'lr': 0.001, 'name': 'adam'}, kernel_variance_bounds=[-4, 8], lengthscale_bounds=[-1.3010299956639813, 2], lengthscales=None, kernel_variance=None)[source]

Class for the Gaussian Process, single output based on maximum likelihood hyperparameters. Uses the dimension scaled lengthscale priors from the paper “Vanilla Bayesian Optimization Performs Great in High Dimensions” (2024), by Hvarfner, Carl and Hellsten, Erik Orm and Nardi, Luigi

Parameters:

  • train_x (JAX array of training points, shape (n_samples, n_features)) – The initial training points for the GP.

  • train_y (JAX array of training values, shape (n_samples,)) – The initial training values for the GP.

  • noise (Scalar noise level for the GP) – Default is 1e-8. This is the noise level for the GP.

  • kernel (Kernel type for the GP) – Default is ‘rbf’. This is the kernel type for the GP. Can be ‘rbf’ or ‘matern’.

  • optimizer (Optimizer type for the GP) – Default is ‘adam’. This is the optimizer type for the GP.

  • kernel_variance_bounds (Bounds for the kernel variance of the GP (in log10 space)) – Default is [-4,4]. These are the bounds for the kernel variance of the GP.

  • lengthscale_bounds (Bounds for the length scale of the GP (in log10 space)) – Default is [np.log10(0.05),2]. These are the boundsfor the length scale of the GP.

neg_mll(log10_params)[source]
class jaxbo.gp.SAAS_GP(train_x, train_y, noise=1e-08, kernel='rbf', optimizer='adam', optimizer_kwargs={'lr': 0.001, 'name': 'adam'}, kernel_variance_bounds=[-4, 8], lengthscale_bounds=[-1.3010299956639813, 2], tausq_bounds=[-4, 4], lengthscales=None, kernel_variance=None, tausq=None)[source]

Bases: GP

hyperparam_priors: str = 'saas'
__init__(train_x, train_y, noise=1e-08, kernel='rbf', optimizer='adam', optimizer_kwargs={'lr': 0.001, 'name': 'adam'}, kernel_variance_bounds=[-4, 8], lengthscale_bounds=[-1.3010299956639813, 2], tausq_bounds=[-4, 4], lengthscales=None, kernel_variance=None, tausq=None)[source]

Class for the Gaussian Process with SAAS priors, using maximum likelihood hyperparameters. The implementation is based on the paper “High-Dimensional Bayesian Optimization with Sparse Axis-Aligned Subspaces”, 2021 by David Eriksson and Martin Jankowiak. :type train_x: :param train_x: The initial training points for the GP. :type train_x: JAX array of training points, shape (n_samples, n_features) :type train_y: :param train_y: The initial training values for the GP. :type train_y: JAX array of training values, shape (n_samples,) :type noise: :param noise: Default is 1e-8. This is the noise level for the GP. :type noise: Scalar noise level for the GP :type kernel: :param kernel: Default is ‘rbf’. This is the kernel type for the GP. Can be ‘rbf’ or ‘matern’. :type kernel: Kernel type for the GP :type optimizer: :param optimizer: Default is ‘adam’. This is the optimizer type for the GP. :type optimizer: Optimizer type for the GP :type kernel_variance_bounds: :param kernel_variance_bounds: Default is [-4,4]. These are the bounds for the kernel variance of the GP. :type kernel_variance_bounds: Bounds for the kernel variance of the GP (in log10 space) :type lengthscale_bounds: :param lengthscale_bounds: Default is [np.log10(0.05),2]. These are the bounds for the length scale of the GP. :type lengthscale_bounds: Bounds for the length scale of the GP (in log10 space) :type tausq_bounds: :param tausq_bounds: Default is [-4,4]. These are the bounds for the tausq parameter of the GP. :type tausq_bounds: Bounds for the tausq parameter of the GP (in log10 space)

neg_mll(log10_params)[source]
fit(maxiter=200, n_restarts=4)[source]

Fits the GP using maximum likelihood hyperparameters with the chosen optimizer.

Parameters:

  • maxiter (int) – The maximum number of iterations for the optimizer. Default is 200.

  • n_restarts (int) – The number of restarts for the optimizer. Default is 4.

classmethod load(filename, **kwargs)[source]

Loads a SAAS_GP from a file

  • **kwargs – Additional keyword arguments to pass to the GP constructor

Returns:

gp – The loaded SAAS_GP object

Return type:

SAAS_GP

jaxbo.gp.load_gp(filename, gp_type='auto', **kwargs)[source]

Utility function to load a GP from a file, automatically detecting the GP type if not specified

Parameters:

  • filename (str) – The name of the file to load the GP from (with or without .npz extension)

  • gp_type (str) – The type of GP to create. Can be ‘auto’, ‘GP’, ‘DSLP’, ‘SAAS’. If ‘auto’, attempts to detect the type based on the saved parameters. Default is ‘auto’.

  • **kwargs – Additional keyword arguments to pass to the GP constructor

Returns:

gp – The loaded GP object (GP, DSLP_GP, or SAAS_GP)

Return type:

GP

nested_sampler

jaxbo.nested_sampler.compute_integrals(logl=None, logvol=None, reweight=None, squared=False)[source]
jaxbo.nested_sampler.renormalise_log_weights(log_weights)[source]
jaxbo.nested_sampler.resample_equal(samples, aux, weights=None, logwts=None, rng=None)[source]
jaxbo.nested_sampler.prior_transform(x)[source]
jaxbo.nested_sampler.nested_sampling_Dy(gp, ndim=1, dlogz=0.1, dynamic=True, logz_std=True, maxcall=None, boost_maxcall=1, print_progress=True, equal_weights=False, sample_method='rwalk', rng=None)[source]

Nested Sampling using Dynesty

Parameters:

  • gp (saas_fbgp) – Gaussian Process model

  • ndim (int) – Number of dimensions

  • dlogz (float) – Log evidence goal

  • dynamic (bool) – Use dynamic nested sampling, see Dynesty documentation for more details

  • logz_std (bool) – Compute the upper and lower bounds on logZ using the GP uncertainty

  • maxcall (int) – Maximum number of function calls

  • boost_maxcall (int) – Boost the maximum number of function calls

  • progress (bool) – Print progress of the nested sampling run

Return type:

tuple[ndarray, Dict, bool]

Returns:

  • samples (ndarray) – Equally weighted samples from the nested sampler

  • logz_dict (dict) – Dictionary containing the mean, upper and lower bounds on logZ and the logZ error from the nested sampler

optim

jaxbo.optim.optimize_optax(fun, fun_args=(), fun_kwargs={}, ndim=1, bounds=None, x0=None, optimizer_kwargs={'early_stop_patience': 25, 'lr': 0.001, 'name': 'adam'}, maxiter=200, n_restarts=4, verbose=False)[source]

Standalone method to minimize a function using JAX and optax. Runs multiple restarts sequentially with early stopping per restart.

Parameters:

  • fun (Callable) – The objective function to minimize.

  • fun_args (Optional[Tuple]) – Positional arguments to pass to the objective function.

  • fun_kwargs (Optional[dict]) – Keyword arguments to pass to the objective function.

  • ndim (int) – Number of parameters.

  • bounds (Optional[Union[List, Tuple, jnp.ndarray]]) – Parameter bounds in shape (2, ndim).

  • x0 (Optional[jnp.ndarray]) – Initial guess for the parameters, rescaled to unit space.

  • optimizer_kwargs (Optional[dict]) – Additional keyword arguments to pass to the optimizer.

  • maxiter (int) – Maximum number of iterations.

  • n_restarts (int) – Number of restarts for the optimization.

  • verbose (bool) – Whether to print progress messages.

Returns:

The best parameters found and the corresponding function value.

Return type:

Tuple[jnp.ndarray, float]

jaxbo.optim.optimize_scipy(fun, fun_args=(), fun_kwargs={}, ndim=1, bounds=None, x0=None, optimizer_kwargs={'ftol': 1e-06, 'gtol': 1e-06, 'method': 'L-BFGS-B'}, maxiter=200, n_restarts=4, verbose=False)[source]

Standalone method to minimize a function using scipy.optimize.minimize.

Parameters:

  • fun (Callable) – The objective function to minimize

  • fun_args (tuple, optional) – Additional arguments to pass to the function

  • fun_kwargs (dict, optional) – Additional keyword arguments to pass to the function

  • ndim (int) – Number of parameters.

  • bounds (Optional[Union[List, Tuple, jnp.ndarray]]) – Parameter bounds in shape (2, ndim).

  • x0 (Optional[jnp.ndarray]) – Initial guess for the parameters, rescaled to unit space.

  • optimizer_kwargs (Optional[dict]) – Additional keyword arguments to pass to the optimizer.

  • maxiter (int) – Maximum number of iterations.

  • n_restarts (int) – Number of restarts for the optimization.

  • verbose (bool) – Whether to print progress messages.

Returns:

The best parameters found and the corresponding function value.

Return type:

Tuple[jnp.ndarray, float]

run

jaxbo.run.run_bobe(likelihood, likelihood_kwargs={}, verbosity='INFO', log_file=None, **sampler_kwargs)[source]

High-level wrapper to run the BOBE sampler. This function handles all MPI setup and logic.

Parameters:

  • likelihood (Union[Callable, str]) – The log-likelihood function or a string identifier for a Cobaya model.

  • likelihood_kwargs (Dict[str, Any]) – Additional keyword arguments to pass to the likelihood. See loglike.py for details.

  • verbosity (str) – The logging verbosity level.

  • log_file (Optional[str]) – The path to a log file.

  • sampler_kwargs – Additional keyword arguments to pass to the sampler. See bo.py for details.
